thread.title: Bill Simmons: ESPN Didn#039;t Care About #039;Grantland#039;
thread.title_full: Bill Simmons: ESPN Didn#039;t Care About #039;Grantland#039;

title: Bill Simmons: ESPN Didn#039;t Care About #039;Grantland#039;
text:
Get Sports Alerts 
5 Oct 2015 07:11 AM EST 
For the second day in a row, Bill Simmons took shots at his former longtime employer, ESPN, on his new podcast. On Friday, the outspoken sports analyst talked with former Grantland staff writer, now New York Times critic at large, Wesley Morris and said ESPN did not support Grantland, the blog started by Simmons. He said, "Websites are like plants, you got to water them"Unfortunately, ESPN is good at building stuff and creating stuff, launching stuff, but there comes a point where you have to decide what does this mean, how can we get from point A to point B to point C to point D to point E. We weren't even on their mobile page until I think January. We just had this tiny little hyperlink at the bottom of the ESPN.com mobile site." Simmons said Grantland was understaffed, but everyone did what they could to make it a success.
